quotes.quote: Oh farmers, pray that your summers be wet and your winters clear.
quotes.speaker: Virgil

quotes.quote: Blessed be the fruit of thy cattle, the increase of thy kine, and the flocks of thy sheep.
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Deut. 28:4

quotes.quote: Do not throw the arrow which will return against you.
quotes.speaker: Kurdish Proverb

quotes.quote: It is entirely seemly for a young man killed in battle to lie mangled by the bronze spear. In his death all things appear fair.
quotes.speaker: Homer

quotes.quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach a man how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
quotes.speaker: Lao Tzu

quotes.quote: If you speak the truth, have a foot in the stirrup.
quotes.speaker: Turkish Proverb

quotes.quote: If you chase two rabbits, you will lose them both.
quotes.speaker: Native American saying

quotes.quote: It is from their foes, not their friends, that cities learn the lesson of building high walls.
quotes.speaker: Aristophanes

quotes.quote: Meditation brings wisdom; lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back.
quotes.speaker: The Buddha

quotes.quote: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
quotes.speaker: Confucius

quotes.quote: I am the Lord thy God. Thou shalt have no other gods before Me.
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Exodus

quotes.quote: Nature herself has imprinted on the minds of all the idea of God.
quotes.speaker: Cicero

quotes.quote: Not at all similar are the race of the immortal gods and the race of men who walk upon the earth.
quotes.speaker: Homer

quotes.quote: Hath not the potter power over the clay, to make one vessel unto honor, and another unto dishonor?
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Romans

quotes.quote: The Lord bless you and keep you; the Lord make His face to shine upon you and be gracious to you; the Lord lift up His countenance upon you and give you peace.
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Numbers

quotes.quote: You can't direct the wind, but you can adjust your sails.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote: Put your shoulder to the wheel.
quotes.speaker: Aesop

quotes.quote: True glory consists in doing what deserves to be written, in writing what deserves to be read.
quotes.speaker: Pliny the Elder

quotes.quote: Art for art's sake is an empty phrase. Art for the sake of truth, art for the sake of the good and the beautiful, that is the faith I am searching for.
quotes.speaker: George Sand

quotes.quote: Words have the power to both destroy and heal. When words are both true and kind, they can change our world.
quotes.speaker: The Buddha

quotes.quote: For everything there is a season and a time for every purpose under heaven.
quotes.speaker: Ecclesiastes

quotes.quote: To bring about the rule of righteousness in the land, so that the strong should not harm the weak.
quotes.speaker: Hammurabi's Code; Prologue

quotes.quote: The wisest men follow their own direction.
quotes.speaker: Euripides

quotes.quote: And on the pedestal these words appear: 'My name is Ozymandias, king of kings: Look on my works, ye Mighty, and despair!' Nothing beside remains.
quotes.speaker: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quotes.quote: Everything is worth what its purchaser will pay for it.
quotes.speaker: Publius Syrius

quotes.quote: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players. They have their exits and their entrances; and one man in his time plays many parts.
quotes.speaker: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: You should hammer your iron when it is glowing hot.
quotes.speaker: Publius Syrus

quotes.quote: Some books are to be tasted, others to be swallowed, and some to be chewed and digested.
quotes.speaker: Sir Francis Bacon

quotes.quote: If in other sciences we should arrive at certainty without doubt and truth without error, it behooves us to place the foundations of knowledge in mathematics.
quotes.speaker: Roger Bacon

quotes.quote: And them that take the sword shall perish by the sword.
quotes.speaker: The Bible, Matthew

quotes.quote: A multitude of rulers is not a good thing. Let there be one ruler, one king.
quotes.speaker: Herodotus

quotes.quote: Banking establishments are more dangerous than standing armies.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of the expanding bureaucracy.
quotes.speaker: Unknown

quotes.quote: I am the state.
quotes.speaker: Louis XIV

quotes.quote: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
quotes.speaker: Antoine de Saint-Exupry

quotes.quote: I will to my lord be true and faithful, and love all which he loves and shun all which he shuns.
quotes.speaker: Anglo Saxon Oath of Fealty

quotes.quote: People of the same trade seldom meet together, even for merriment and diversion, but the conversation ends in a conspiracy against the public.
quotes.speaker: Adam Smith

quotes.quote: A god from the machine.
quotes.speaker: Menander

quotes.quote: If music be the food of love, play on.
quotes.speaker: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: One doesn't discover new lands without losing sight of the shore.
quotes.speaker: Andre Gide

quotes.quote: I cannot live without books.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I have gained this by philosophy: that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law.
quotes.speaker: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Two cities have been formed by two loves: the earthly by the love of self; the heavenly by the love of God.
quotes.speaker: St. Augustine

quotes.quote: Astronomy compels the soul to look upwards and leads us from this world to another.
quotes.speaker: Plato

quotes.quote: Chemistry means the difference between poverty and starvation and the abundant life.
quotes.speaker: Robert Brent

quotes.quote: No freeman shall be taken, imprisoned, or in any other way destroyed, except by the lawful judgment of his peers.
quotes.speaker: The Magna Carta

quotes.quote: Corporation, n. An ingenious device for obtaining individual profit without individual responsibility.
quotes.speaker: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: It has been said that democracy is the worst form of government except all the others that have been tried.
quotes.speaker: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Compound interest is the most powerful force in the universe.
quotes.speaker: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: There is no wealth like knowledge, no poverty like ignorance.
quotes.speaker: Ali ibn Abi-Talib

quotes.quote: You can get more of what you want with a kind word and a gun than you can with just a kind word.
quotes.speaker: Al Capone

quotes.quote: Any society that would give up a little liberty to gain a little security will deserve neither and lose both.
quotes.speaker: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: I must study politics and war that my sons may have liberty to study mathematics and philosophy.
quotes.speaker: John Adams

quotes.quote: Victorious warriors win first and then go to war, while defeated warriors go to war first and then seek to win.
quotes.speaker: Sun Tzu

quotes.quote: A man does not have himself killed for a half-pence a day or for a petty distinction. You must speak to the soul in order to electrify him.
quotes.speaker: Napoleon Bonaparte

quotes.quote: What gunpowder did for war, the printing press has done for the mind.
quotes.speaker: Wendell Phillips

quotes.quote: The whole is more than the sum of its parts.
quotes.speaker: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Political power grows out of the barrel of a gun.
quotes.speaker: Mao Zedong

quotes.quote: Artillery adds dignity to what would otherwise be a vulgar brawl.
quotes.speaker: Frederick the Great

quotes.quote: People can have the Model T in any color - so long as it's black.
quotes.speaker: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survive, but the one most responsive to change.
quotes.speaker: Charles Darwin

quotes.quote: Everything in life is somewhere else, and you get there in a car.
quotes.speaker: E.B. White

quotes.quote: When I give food to the poor, they call me a saint. When I ask why the poor have no food, they call me a communist.
quotes.speaker: Dom Helder Camara

quotes.quote: We will make electricity so cheap that only the rich will burn candles.
quotes.speaker: Thomas Edison

quotes.quote: The great masses of the people... will more easily fall victims to a big lie than to a small one.
quotes.speaker: Adolf Hitler

quotes.quote: If the radiance of a thousand suns were to burst at once into the sky, that would be like the splendor of the Mighty One... I am become Death, the Shatterer of Worlds.
quotes.speaker: J. Robert Oppenheimer, quoting "The Bhagavad Gita"

quotes.quote: There is one rule for the industrialist and that is: Make the best quality of goods possible at the lowest cost possible, paying the highest wage possible.
quotes.speaker: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: As to diseases make a habit of two things - to help, or at least, to do no harm.
quotes.speaker: Hippocrates

quotes.quote: To every action there is always opposed an equal reaction.
quotes.speaker: Isaac Newton

quotes.quote: I fooled you, I fooled you, I got pig iron, I got pig iron, I got all pig iron.
quotes.speaker: Lonnie Donegan, "Rock Island Line"

quotes.quote: I do not feel obliged to believe that the same God who has endowed us with sense, reason, and intellect has intended us to forgo their use.
quotes.speaker: Galileo Galilei

quotes.quote: You would make a ship sail against the winds and currents by lighting a bon-fire under her deck? I have no time for such nonsense.
quotes.speaker: Napoleon, on Robert Fulton's Steamship

quotes.quote: Before that steam drill shall beat me down, I'll die with my hammer in my hand.
quotes.speaker: from "John Henry, the Steel-Driving Man"

quotes.quote: Oh! I have slipped the surly bonds of Earth - Put out my hand and touched the Face of God.
quotes.speaker: John Gillespie Magee, Junior

quotes.quote: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
quotes.speaker: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Never trust a computer you can't throw out a window.
quotes.speaker: Steve Wozniak

quotes.quote: We do not inherit the earth from our ancestors, we borrow it from our children.
quotes.speaker: Native American Song

quotes.quote: There is a single light of science and to brighten it anywhere is to brighten it everywhere.
quotes.speaker: Isaac Asimov

quotes.quote: For once you have tasted flight you will walk the earth with your eyes turned skywards, for there you have been and there you will long to return.
quotes.speaker: Leonardo Da Vinci

quotes.quote: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
quotes.speaker: Arthur C. Clarke

quotes.quote: The future will be better tomorrow.
quotes.speaker: Dan Quayle

quotes.quote: Soon it will be a sin for parents to have a child which carries the heavy burden of genetic disease.
quotes.speaker: Bob Edwards

quotes.quote: Nothing travels faster than the speed of light with the possible exception of bad news, which obeys its own special laws.
quotes.speaker: Douglas Adams

quotes.quote: The only thing worse than being talked about is not being talked about.
quotes.speaker: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: I just want to say one word to you. Just one word: plastics.
quotes.speaker: Calder Willingham, The Graduate

quotes.quote: Then one fine mornin' she puts on a New York station. You know her life was saved by Rock 'n' Roll.
quotes.speaker: The Velvet Underground, "Rock And Roll"

quotes.quote: Tell me what you eat, and I will tell you what you are.
quotes.speaker: Anthelme Brillat-Savarin

quotes.quote: The real problem is not whether machines think, but whether men do.
quotes.speaker: B.F. Skinner

quotes.quote: The Earth is the cradle of the mind, but one cannot eternally live in a cradle.
quotes.speaker: Konstantin E. Tsiolkovsky

quotes.quote: Beep... beep... beep... beep...
quotes.speaker: Sputnik I

quotes.quote: Behind a veil, unseen yet present, I was the forceful soul that moved this mighty body.
quotes.speaker: Jean Racine

quotes.quote: What is happiness? The feeling that power is growing, that resistance is overcome.
quotes.speaker: Friedrich Nietzsche
